alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 8:02PM CDT until May 26 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Camden affecting Ouachita and Calhoun Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Camden. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Low lying pastures and timber land along the river begins to flood. Sandy Beach Park at Camden starts to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 22.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Action stage is 25.5 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date Ouachita River Camden 26.0 22.8 Mon 7 PM 25.5 23.5 21.2 25.5 7 PM 5/24 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
